text: To the Last Breath: Three Women Fight for the Truth Behind a Child's Tragic Murder, written by author and journalist Carlton Stowers, recounts the true story of the mysterious death of a two-year-old child. Initially the infant's death was said to be of natural causes, but further investigation revealed that the child was suffocated by her father. ==Critical reception== *Booklist praised Stowers for his “masterful chronicle of a troubling case.” *The book won the Edgar Award for Best Fact Crime in 1998. ==References== Category:1998 non-fiction books Category:Edgar Award-winning works Category:Non-fiction books about murders in the United States Category:St. Martin's Press books Category:Violence against children
